texts.value: Receptor to interleukin-8, which is a powerful neutrophils chemotactic factor (PubMed:1840701). Binding of IL-8 to the receptor causes activation of neutrophils. This response is mediated via a G-protein that activates a phosphatidylinositol-calcium second messenger system (PubMed:8662698)
Interacts with IL8 (PubMed:1840701). Interacts with GNAI2 (PubMed:8662698)
Belongs to the G-protein coupled receptor 1 family

citation.title: Structure and functional expression of a human interleukin-8 receptor.
Molecular characterization of receptors for human interleukin-8, GRO/melanoma growth-stimulatory activity and neutrophil activating peptide-2.
The high-affinity interleukin 8 receptor gene (IL8RA) maps to the 2q33-q36 region of the human genome: cloning of a pseudogene (IL8RBP) for the low-affinity receptor.
Comparison of the genomic organization and promoter function for human interleukin-8 receptors A and B.
Molecular evolution of CXCR1, a G protein-coupled receptor involved in signal transduction of neutrophils.
Cloning of human full open reading frames in Gateway(TM) system entry vector (pDONR201).
Complete sequencing and characterization of 21,243 full-length human cDNAs.

Structure of a CXC chemokine-receptor fragment in complex with interleukin-8.
